revision.comment: /* More crap I have to put up with */[[WP:NOINDEX|Noindexing]] Arbitration pages
revision.text:
Anyone, whether directly involved or not, may add evidence to this page. Please make a header for your evidence and sign your comments with your name.
When placing evidence here, please be considerate of the arbitrators and '''be concise'''. Long, rambling, or stream-of-conciousness rants are not helpful.
As such, it is extremely important that you use the prescribed format. Submitted evidence should include a link to the actual page diff; links to the page itself are not sufficient. For example, to cite the edit by Mennonot to the article Anomalous phenomenon adding a link to Hundredth Monkey use this form: <nowiki>[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Anomalous_phenomenon&diff=5587219&oldid=5584644]</nowiki> [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Anomalous_phenomenon&diff=5587219&oldid=5584644].
This page is not for general discussion - for that, see [[Wikipedia talk:{{PAGENAME}}|talk page]].
Please make a section for your evidence and add evidence only in your own section. Please limit your evidence to a maximum 1000 words and 100 diffs, a much shorter, concise presentation is more likely to be effective. Please focus on the issues raised in the complaint and answer and on diffs which illustrate behavior which relates to the issues.
If you disagree with some evidence you see here, please cite the evidence '''in your own section''' and provide counter-evidence, or an explanation of why the evidence is misleading. Do not edit within the evidence section of any other user.
Be aware that the Arbitrators may at times rework this page to try to make it more coherent. If you are a participant in the case or a third party, please don't try to refactor the page, let the Arbitrators do it. If you object to evidence which is inserted by other participants or third parties please cite the evidence and voice your objections within your own section of the page. It is especially important to not remove evidence presented by others. If something is put in the wrong place, please leave it for the arbitrators to move.
__TOC__
==Evidence compiled from [[User:Smoddy/Irate]]== See the talk page for the people that compiled this list.
===Personal attacks=== ====Irate's talk page==== Irate's [[User talk:Irate|talk page]] ([http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&action=history history]) *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=6842482] calling [[User:198|198]] an "idiot" & "childish". *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=6850603] calling 198 a "pompous oaf". *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=6963518 ] calling 198 a "fool". *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=7155379] deletes the entire conversation with 198 with the personal attacks. (Though, to be fair, he did delete the entire page immediately afterwards, so this can probably be ignored) *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=8051056] deleting something mildly critical, and calling it vandalism *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=8051601] telling [[User:Sannse|Sannse]] to "get lost" because he threatened to block him over 3RR *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=8188472] telling [[User:Cool Hand Luke|Cool Hand Luke]] that he is reporting him for abuse of sysop powers re 3RR *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=8198834] refusing to talk to CHL rather than file RFC *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9109957], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9176126], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9538558], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9559212] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9889205] deleting things slightly critical of him. *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9538741] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=9562203] labelling Dr Zen a vandal *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=10874135] calling [[User:Curps|Curps]] a "crtin" (sic) *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=10875040] calls Curps "mad" *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11579794] describes [[User:Juppiter|Juppiter]] as being "far up your own arse" *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11581228] calls [[User:Smoddy|Smoddy]] a "paternalistic moron" *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11581380] calling a request by [[User:Matt Crypto|Matt Crypto]] not to make personal attacks a personal attack *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11584727] calls Matt Crypto "condescending and patronising" *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11585196] calls [[User:Violetriga|Violetriga]] "Vile Trigger"
====Against Jayjg==== '''Insults toward [[User:Jayjg]]''': "ignorant", "arrogant", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Wikipedia%3AVotes_for_deletion%2FOccupation_of_Palestine&diff=6068625&oldid=6067398] "snide little gob shite", "manipulative", "without any value", "spoilt brat", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Wikipedia%3AVotes_for_deletion%2FOccupation_of_Palestine&diff=6075797&oldid=6068863] "dishonest", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Wikipedia%3AVotes_for_deletion%2FOccupation_of_Palestine&diff=6079193&oldid=6078373] "dishonest and manipulative", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=User_talk%3AIrate&diff=6096854&oldid=6095401] "unpleasant toerag", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Wikipedia%3AVotes_for_deletion%2FOccupation_of_Palestine&diff=6080603&oldid=6079594] "self-righteous prig", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Wikipedia%3AVotes_for_deletion%2FFox_Hunt&diff=6098016&oldid=6095847] "self-serving", "apparatchik", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3AIrate&diff=6092320&oldid=6083452] "bigoted", "biased", "hiding foul ideas behind pleasant words", "dishonest and manipulative", [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=6097125] *[[User:Jfdwolff]]'s request Re: Jayjg VfD [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3AIrate&diff=6082316&oldid=6082125] "Yeah, he had a little poke somewhere else..." [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=6082316] Other users elaborate, but Irate makes several more insults against Jayjg until the topic culminates in [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=6696813#User:Jayjg this state]. *When confronted by Jayjg with the statement that he has insulted Jayjg, responds "And what were those things, or is this just another example of you blowing things up to hise your racism?" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:198&diff=prev&oldid=6855333] When provided with evidence, insists that "It can only be considered abuse if it's not true. You original message on this page, validates several of my complaints and you last message validates some more." [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:198&diff=next&oldid=6855744]
====Smoddy's talk page==== [[User talk:Smoddy]] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Smoddy&diff=11582308&oldid=11581458] Describing Smoddy as "Shit for brains"
====Template talk:In the news==== {{article|Template talk:In the news}} argument with [[User:Violetriga|Violet/Riga]] et al *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8921123&oldid=8921078], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8903805&oldid=8903693], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8902763&oldid=8901866], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8903422&oldid=8903290], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8891031&oldid=8890961], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8891633&oldid=8891499], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8891031&oldid=8890961] name calling again: "Vile Riga" is dishonest, arrogant and lacks integrity and sense *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8920940&oldid=8920686], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8920645&oldid=8920605] accusations of vandalism and destroying context after attempts to move the discussion away from that talk page and to user talk pages *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8919722&oldid=8919539], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:In_the_news&diff=8919335&oldid=8919267] accusations of admins abusing their powers and threats to come back under different ID/IPs
====Vacuum's user page==== '''Attacks against [[User:Vacuum]]'''. Irate added, "This user is a dishonest editor who does not care about votes or democracy. Noone should take anything they do at face value" to user's page three times [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:Vacuum&diff=9537804&oldid=9534860][http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:Vacuum&diff=next&oldid=9538494][http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:Vacuum&diff=next&oldid=9538828]. When Vacuum asked ''why'' he was a vandal, Irate ignored the question by deleting queries. [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=9538558&oldid=9538460][http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=9538812][http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=9538872] "remove junk." Irate has to date never edited Vacuum's '''''talk''''' page.
Irate also refused mediation with user [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=9564131] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=9583781].
===The clitoris article=== {{article|clitoris}} and it's {{article|talk:clitoris}} *Revert wars and accusations ("Mr. Integrity-free")
[[User:Cool Hand Luke|Cool Hand Luke]] made a talk request about not insulting users on Clitoris [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=prev&oldid=8741416] User replied by deleting "retard comment" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3AIrate&diff=0&oldid=8741416] and making personal attack on user's talk page [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Cool_Hand_Luke&diff=8754685&oldid=8741407].
'''Reverted [[Clitoris]] 11 times in 18 hours''', 18 minutes while ignoring talk page remarks. Was blocked at 17:06, 2 Dec 2004, but unblocked 23:29 becasue [[User:Anthony DiPierro]] was not blocked for his four reverts, and at least one admin ([[User:Theresa knott|Theresa knott]]) didn't feel this was treating all parties equally. *First revert, 20:37, 1 Dec 2004 [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8027873&oldid=8027619], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8028020&oldid=8027873], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8028224&oldid=8028020], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8028876&oldid=8028692], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8029006&oldid=8028876], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8029050&oldid=8029006], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8029095&oldid=8029050], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8029116&oldid=8029095], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8050439&oldid=8049727], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8050547&oldid=8050439], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clitoris&diff=8050828&oldid=8050547]. Last revert 13:55, 2 Dec 2004
===Other revert wars=== Argument with {{user|82.35.37.118}} about Liverpool categories, reverting many articles without full discussion: *All edits 11:20, 6 Apr 2005 – 12:11, 6 Apr 2005 *All edits 18:54, 6 Apr 2005 – 20:28, 6 Apr 2005 *Responding to [[User:Solipsist|Solipsist]] (an outsider trying to help) "I dont give a fuck about Wikiquette" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3AIrate&diff=11954178&oldid=11953711] *Talking about a problem with an anon: "the same kind of fuck you arrogance" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=11969217&oldid=11967740] *"I will be reverting all his stuff soon" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=12036283&oldid=12036085]
===3rd of April 2005 spree=== [[3 April]] [[2005]] spree (all contributions between 12:35 and 14:34 on [[3 April]] [[2005]]): *Removing polite requests for him to comment at the RFC against him, calling people "liar" and "scum" *Vandalism of a user page, repeatedly placing deletion tags on [[User:Violetriga]] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User%3AVioletriga&diff=11832925&oldid=11832891] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User%3AVioletriga&diff=11832975&oldid=11832933] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User%3AVioletriga&diff=11833006&oldid=11833003] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User%3AVioletriga&diff=11833041&oldid=11833020] and creating [[Wikipedia:Votes for deletion/Violetriga]] (and subsequently 3RR'd there) and [[User talk:Irate/sumtalk]]: "This user is a dishonest and manipulative peice of scum and should be purged from the system" *Similar vandalism of a second user page ([[User:Calton]]) [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:Calton&diff=prev&oldid=11834840] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:Calton&diff=prev&oldid=11835111] and creation of [[Wikipedia:Votes for deletion/Calton]] *Posts at [[WP:AN/I]] including name-calling and accusations
===Abuse of user pages=== As well as the 3rd of April user page VFDs...
*On [[User:Jayjg]] 21:21, [[22 September]] [[2004]] – [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User%3AJayjg&diff=6080583&oldid=6079366]
===Attempts at an RfC=== There has been a [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment|request for comment filed against Irate]], which, despite notice and requests for a response ([http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11586847], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11666025], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=11694443], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=11832091&oldid=11831626]) Irate has not responded to.
==Evidence presented by Joe Dunckley ([[user:Steinsky|Steinsky]])== ===6 April=== * Starting at 11:20 ** Anonymous user [[User_talk:82.35.37.118|82.35.37.118]] had modified the categorisation of articles relating to the city of [[Liverpool]], which Jirate had contributed to, in order to standardise them to the system used by other British cities and counties. Jirate disagreed with the system and asked 82.* to explain why he was editing [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_talk:82.35.37.118]. Jirate immediately reverted all of 82.*'s edits with the edit summary "vandalism", without providing evidence that 82.* acted in bad faith, or waiting for a reply from 82.* [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Contributions&limit=50&offset=250&hideminor=0&namespace=&target=Irate]. After 82.* had replied explaining that (s)he was standardising the categorisation system Jirate failed to keep his cool and continued to revert articles with the summary "vandalism".
* 20:20 ** When administrators rejected Jirate's claim that 82.* was a vandal and removed his listing from the noticeboard, Jirate reverted edits with personal attacks [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Administrators%27_noticeboard&action=history].
===7 April=== * Starting at 17:07 ** Jirate edited 82.*'s user page to add an accusation that the user is "not trustworthy", which I blanked under the policy of no personal attacks. On [[User_talk:Steinsky#Justify_yourself|my user talk page]] Jirate then accused me of implicitly attacking him and vandalism by blanking his edit, and then continued to add his accusation to 82.*'s user page throughout the evening despite blanking and requests to stop by several users including myself [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:82.35.37.118&oldid=12002195]. On Jirate's talk page I asked Jirate to stay calm and engage in dialogue over the original issue of categorisation [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&oldid=12005914#Justify_yourself], to which Jirate responded by accusing me of supporting vandalism, and describing my request to follow the rules as a personal attack.
* 20:00 ** After discussing how to resolve the dispute in #wikipedia [[user:Ugen64]] reiterated the call to stay calm and engage in dialogue. In deleting all comments on the matter from his talk page, Jirate described the edits as "vandalism by scum".
* From 20:17 ** Rather than engage in dialogue Jirate created [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment|RfCs]] against those who had asked him to stick to the rules.
==Evidence presented by [[User:Thryduulf|Thryduulf]]== ===Personal attacks=== *8 Apr 2005 **11:16: Irate makes a statement on the [[Wikipedia:Requests for arbitration/Irate|main page of this RfC]] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia%3ARequests_for_arbitration%2FIrate&diff=12033721&oldid=12033153]. This consists of: ***valid questions to the ArbCom (points 1, 2 and 3) ***A borderline personal attack on the arbcom members (6) ***definate personal attacks on the arcom members (4,7) ***a question to the arbcom/threat against two users [[user:Snowspinner|Snowspinner]] and [[user:violetriga|Violet/riga]] (5). I am [[Wikipedia:Assume good faith|assuming good faith]] and presuming that this contains a typo and not a personal attack against Violet/riga. **** Comment by User:Matt Crypto: Good stuff for assuming good faith, but I'm afraid it's not merited here. Irate has persistently and consistently misspelled "Violet/riga" as "Vile triga", even when it has been pointed out to him that this constitutes a personal attack. [[User:Matt Crypto|— Matt <small>Crypto</small>]] 19:30, 8 Apr 2005 (UTC) *****A witty and amusing one, but still... [[User:Violetriga|violet/riga]] [[User_talk:violetriga|(t)]] 22:29, 8 Apr 2005 (UTC)
===Refusal to communicate=== *[[8 April]] [[2005]] **12:29: Snowpsinner comments on Irate's talk page that he has formated the RfCs correctly (see that page for context) and politely explains that if nobody else certifys them that they have failed and relisting them in that circumstance would be "unwise". [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=prev&oldid=12034808] **12:31: Irate removes Snowspinner's comments with the edit summary: ''remove comments from some who should be blocked'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12034808] **12:42: Snowspinner comments on Irate's talk page that "Although it's certainly your right, I encourage you not to delete comments from people you disagree with from your talk page. It makes it seem like you are uninterested in discussion or consensus. Instead, you should [[Wikipedia:Assume good faith|assume good faith.]] [[User:Snowspinner|Snowspinner]] 12:42, Apr 8, 2005 (UTC)" in a new section entitled "comment removal". [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=prev&oldid=12035145] **12:44: Irate removes Snowspinner's section with the edit summary: ''remove more unwanted comments by person that should be banned'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12035145] **12:52: Irate comments on his talk page that "Mail from users who should already be blocked is deleted by antispam unread.--[[User:Irate|Jirate]] 12:52, 2005 Apr 8 (UTC)" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12035374] **13:00: Snowspinner replies: ":Then how am I supposed to make any effort at consensus or reconcilliation? [[User:Snowspinner|Snowspinner]] 13:00, Apr 8, 2005 (UTC)" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12035600] **13:02: Irate again removes Snowspinner's comments with the edit summary: ''remove comments by user who should be banned.'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12035666] **13:26: Snowspinner offers to be Irate's advocate on this case [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=prev&oldid=12036491] **13:35:Irate removes Snowspinner's comments with the usual edit summary [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12036491] *[[10 April]] [[2005]] **17:52:Irate removes another attempt at communication from Snowspinner, 1 minute after he posts it. This time the edit summary is: revrt vandalism [sic]. [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=next&oldid=12127501]
===Removal of injunction=== *8 Apr 2005 **15:22: Irate replaces the temporary injunction at [[Wikipedia:Requests for arbitration/Irate]] with a message stating that he beleives the injunction is invalid. [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Requests_for_arbitration/Irate&diff=next&oldid=12039723]
==Evidence presented by [[User:Violetriga|violet/riga]] [[User_talk:violetriga|(t)]]== ===Attempts at friendly communication=== *10 Apr 2005 **15:57: Matt Crypto attempts to communicate with Irate on [[User talk:Irate]] only to have it removed: "revert vanlism" (sic) [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=prev&oldid=12123998] **16:03: A second time: "revert vandalism" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=12124116&oldid=12124061] **16:05: Irate says that any attempted communication "will be removed as vandalism" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3AIrate&diff=12124203&oldid=12124116] **16:11: "revert vandlism" (sic) [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=12124313&oldid=12124295] **16:15: A fourth time: "revert vandalism" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Irate&diff=12124994&oldid=12124406]
==Evidence presented by [[User:Irate|Jirate]]==
===Comments mad by Arbcomm=== :Jirate Yuo own me an explanation :Grunt For what? The Injunction against you? :Jirate Well you still owe it to me. :Grunt Okay, sure. :Grunt How about: Making large number of personal attacks? :Grunt I can get you a large number of diffs if you want them. :Grunt I'm sure the rest of the arbcom is more than happy to oblige, as well. :Jirate What about the people who make them against me like snowspinner and Violet Riga :Jirate No thay have shut up. :Grunt You're more than welcome to provide diffs at the evidence page. :Jirate I want to put RFC in against them an the other liars but you have banned me from that :Grunt You're not helping your cause by engaging in more personal attacks here, you know. :Jirate What personal attack, you have abnned me. I am logging this :Grunt If I were you, I would calm yourself down and maybe take a break for a few days... you might come back with a clearer head and not be inclined to attack everyone in sight. :Jirate That is is a personal attack by you on me. I have asked you questions and you refuse to answer. If I go of and accuse you of being stupid and therefore incapable of dealing with the situation you'll calss that as personall. :Jirate but you proabley don't think yuo attack was. :Grunt What, exactly, am I not answering? And yes, doing what you just said would normally be considered by the community to be an attack. :Jirate Then why isn't you Not calm not clear headed an attack? :Grunt I'm merely stating what I see based on some of the evidence that's been provided in the case. :Jirate So if I say your stupid and say it's based on the evidence of this conversation you will not have a problem? :Grunt The community generally agrees that saying someone is "stupid" cannot be verified by objective fact and would be considered a personal attack. :Grunt If, however, you were to make statement about, say, not taking evidence into account and give objective examples of evidence you don't think is being taken into account, that would not be considered a personal attack. :Jirate If think you'll find that stupid can be verfied far more easily than not being calm or clear headed. :Grunt Actually, it's not. :Grunt And if you'll excuse me, I need to be somewhere else for the next bit. :Grunt I'll be happy to resume this conversation when I return. :Jirate It's not what.
===End from alleged arbcommer===
:Irate stated for the record: :> You still owe me an explnation. :I disagree. But feel free to calculate interest to this alleged debt :while you try to collect it.
:-- : Sean Barrett | It is a mark of insincerity of purpose to spend : sean@epoptic.com | one's time in looking for the sacred Emperor : | in the low-class tea-shops. --Ernest Bramah --[[User:Irate|Jirate]] 14:53, 2005 Apr 10 (UTC)
